title: Consumer surplus for which price control

content.question: Consumer surplus could be the shaded area in which of the following situations?

choices.label: A price floor set at <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mtext>P</mtext><mn>1</mn></msub></math> in the market
A price floor set at <math alttext="P sub 2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the market
A price ceiling set at <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the market

A per-unit subsidy equal to <math alttext="P sub 2, minus P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> granted to producers

A per-unit tax equal to <math alttext="P sub 2, minus P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>2</mn></msub><mo>−</mo><msub><mi mathvariant="normal">P</mi><mn>1</mn></msub></math> imposed on producers

content.answer: A price ceiling set at <math alttext="P sub 1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>P</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></msub></mrow></mstyle></math> in the market

topic.text: 2.6: Market Equilibrium and Consumer and Producer Surplus

skill.text: Skill 2.A: Using economic concepts, principles, or models, explain how a specific economic outcome occurs, or what action should be taken in order to achieve a specific economic outcome.
